title: The Dracoknights Of Thracia
opening: The two faces of the Thracian Peninsula are as distinct as night and day. The peninsula's north, once ruled by several small kingdoms, is graced with rich pastures, while the south, the Kingdom of Thracia, is a harsh wasteland dominated by vast mountains. In ages past, seeking to claim the life-giving northern land as their own, Thracia's infamous wyvern knights have led countless brash attempts to conquer the north, only to be repelled at every turn by the might of House Leonster.

Thracia looked to have won at last following their slaughter of Leonster's army in the Yied Desert, only to be defeated in turn by Blume of Freege, who claimed the land as his own. And so, the so-called Kingdom of North Thracia was born as yet another servant of the Empire. Over a decade has passed since then. Not even Thracia's King Travant, an ambitious man with a thirst for power and glory, dares to challenge the will of the Empire, and so a strange peace looms over the region.

Or so it did, until the arrival of Seliph and his liberation army. Blume's defeat at his own castle has abruptly tipped the balance of the Thracian stalemate. Both the Alster and Leonster territories now lie under the liberation army's control, forcing Blume to retreat to Conote and muster the strength to take Alster back. The southern Manster Castle, governed by the "goddess of lightning", Princess Ishtar, braces itself for the threat of Thracian invaders.

Meanwhile, across the border itself, both King Travant and his border watchman, General Maykov of Meath Castle, remain eerily silent. The people are united in their fondest wish: for the entirety of the Thracian Peninsula to return to the rule of House Leonster. And so dawns yet another battle...

intro.speaker: Blume
intro.line: Nngh... Curses! Never did I imagine that the rebels could pose such a threat. Banba! How could the three of you let yourselves be cowed into fleeing? What a disgrace!

intro.speaker: Banba
intro.line: A thousand apologies, milord. However, you've nothing to worry about anymore. Even as we speak, General Muhammad prepares his brigade to lay siege to Alster, and General Ovo's cavalry are en route to Leonster. We, too, shall rejoin the fray shortly.

intro.speaker: Blume
intro.line: Hrm... Don't you dare fail me this time. And what of King Travant? Why are the promised Thracian reinforcements nowhere to be seen?

intro.speaker: Banba
intro.line: We've yet to receive any response to any of our messengers so far.

intro.speaker: Blume
intro.line: Gah... What in blazes is that snake thinking?

intro.speaker: Banba
intro.line: King Travant is an ambitious man. To blindly trust him would be foolish.

intro.speaker: Blume
intro.line: No matter. Even without his forces, we've more than enough power to stop the rebels cold. Banba! Fotla! Eriu! Move out at once. This time, leave not a single rebel alive!

intro.speaker: Banba
intro.line: Yes, milord. We will not fail.

intro.speaker: Man
intro.line: Sir Ced, please! We all can't take much more of King Blume's abuses! How long... How long will it be until Manster is free from the Empire?

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: Don't lose hope now! Even as we speak, Lord Seliph and his liberators are out there fighting for the District. They'll be here before long. Go! Tell your friends and family that your freedom is so very nearly in reach! Please, my friends, believe me. Manster's freedom is fast approaching!

intro.speaker: Arion
intro.line: Pardon me, Father, but King Blume is requesting our aid yet again. The Empire has already lost both Alster and Leonster to the Isaach rebels. He wishes to use us to help reclaim them.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: The Isaach rebels are led by that Seliph brat... Sigurd's spawn, correct? Heh... Poor, poor Blume. He's getting so old, even little children are a thorn in his side! Pay Blume no heed, Arion. The Empire and the rebels are best left to break themselves on each other for now. We'll mop up the leftovers once they're nice and weak.

intro.speaker: Arion
intro.line: I should have known, Father... All along, you've been waiting out Blume's little storm, haven't you?

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: But of course! It'd make no sense to bend over backward for the man who snatched our hard-won north out from under our noses, would it? Leonster's downfall should have meant a peninsula unified under our rule... I'll neither forgive nor forget Blume's craven conquest.

intro.speaker: Arion
intro.line: Even now, we still lack the power to truly match Grannvale on an even battlefield... I can only imagine your frustration, Father.

intro.speaker: Travant
intro.line: Thracia's fate depends on a unified peninsula. The verdant northern soils are the perfect cure for the famine and poverty wracking our south. We've been shunned and vilified for centuries, dismissed as ravenous hyenas... Yet what choice did we ever have? If not for our answer to this world's craving for sellswords, Thracia would never have had the funds to barely survive as we do. We've toiled in poverty long enough, Arion. It's high time Thracia carved itself a future! A future, I might add, which depends on the outcome of the game laid before us...

intro.speaker: Arion
intro.line: Mm.

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: I have a bad feeling about this, Seliph... Is Leonster well guarded?

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: I believe so, but then again, reinforcing it further certainly wouldn't hurt. Should I send them some support?

intro.speaker: Lewyn
intro.line: Do it. With Blume still on the loose in Conote, there's no sense in skimping on the defenses. Oh, and also, we've received a plea for help from the people of Manster Castle. The sooner our forces reach them, the better.

intro.speaker: Seliph
intro.line: Very well. We shall make the first move!

battle.speaker: Young Woman
battle.line: Please, we beg of you... Do all you can to help sir Ced!

battle.speaker: Young Woman
battle.line: Thank you so much, noble warrior!

battle.speaker: Young Woman
battle.line: Thracia's wyvern knights are still on the prowl 'round these parts. Be careful, won't you…

battle.speaker: Young Man
battle.line: You're with Lord Seliph's liberators? Gods be praised! You've come at last.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: Julia?! You’re safe! Oh, thank heavens…

end.speaker: Julia
end.line: Mm… The enemy seized and imprisoned me here, but I knew… I knew you would rescue me, no matter what.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: The Thracians are on such a different level to anybody we've fought before, Lewyn. It almost feels as if each blow is fueled by pure desperation...

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: See, Thracia's always had a bad lot in life. Much of its land is consumed by mountains. Farming its own food is a near impossible task, so they struggle to keep themselves fed. Thracia's men seek mercenary work to find the money to stay alive, while its women are stuck in whatever dreary jobs they can dig up. Don't get me wrong, Seliph. King Travant is still an awful man, but there's far more than his own petty gain at stake in his schemes. The Thracian army is as loyal to Travant as they come. They ardently believe it's Travant who'll guide Thracia out of its endless famine.

end.speaker: Seliph
end.line: I see... That does make sense...

end.speaker: Lewyn
end.line: The thing is, no amount of poverty will ever justify Thracia's aggression. Travant's brand of nobility and justice would never be accepted anywhere else in the world. All the peninsula's north can see are rowdy aggressors, who threaten their peaceful lives. As harsh as it may seem, Seliph, I trust you know you can't afford to stay your hand here. The Thracian royal family is the enemy, and a grave threat to the north's peace. Stripping them of power is the only choice. That task falls to us, and we can't fail now.

end.speaker: Altena
end.line: The liberators have seized Meath?! Could I have been wrong about them? Oh, Arion.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Ohh, thank you so much! I've heard all the stories about your army, and I've been praying that you'd come someday. Lord Seliph is our beacon of hope! Here, take this power ring. It's not much, but it's all we have to show our gratitude.

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Long ago, Thracia and the states of the Manster District were a single nation. 'Course, you'd never know that from how they've hated each other so for as long as anyone can recall! I wish they could just try to make peace…

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: Gaah! I-I don't believe it... The Connaught Hitman's back for more blood! Run, everyone! Run for it!

visit.speaker: Asaello
visit.line: Er... Shouldn't you be running, too?

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: But you look so sad, mister...

visit.speaker: Girl
visit.line: Take these! We picked up all these fruits in the woods. Eat 'em! They'll make you grow up big and strong! I hope you feel better soon!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: I've heard tell that over in Manster, people're planning a revolt against the Imperial rule. Apparently the ringleader there's some Silessian mage called Ced... The people there are so sure that he's the man for the job. Of course, the real problem for Manster is that Thracia's got their grubby eyes on the city... I hope they'll be alright.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: For as long as anyone can recall, Thracia's wanted to claim this region as their own. And for just as long, House Leonster always stood in their way, wielding their holy lance Gáe Bolg to defend our lands. At least, until Gáe Bolg was lost a decade ago in the Yied Desert... The Thracians ambushed and murdered Prince Quan, his wife Ethlyn, and their daughter Altena as they crossed Yied, and the lance vanished…

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: It was the legendary dracoknight Dain who founded Thracia all those years ago… With his heavenly lance, Gungnir, in hand, he dared to challenge the king of demons himself! Rumor has it that Nova of the crusaders, ancestor of the lords of House Leonster, was in fact a sister to Lord Dain…

visit.speaker: Old Woman
visit.line: Hoo hoo! What brings you all the way out here? You must be quite the curious one! Either way, I want to thank you for coming all this way for such a small and remote town. This here trinket's a thief's band. She's an odd little thing: slip her on and you'll soon find yourself stealing like you've done it all your life. Hoo hoo hoo! Take care of yourself, dearie.

battle-talk.speaker: Julia
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Oh, Julia. Is something the matter?

battle-talk.speaker: Julia
battle-talk.line: I... I'm scared... I sense an evil presence... Something dark... And it's closing in...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: What do you mean?

battle-talk.speaker: Julia
battle-talk.line: (slowly) ...Seliph... Be on your guard... Ishtar is a fierce foe... You cannot fight her... You must not...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Julia! What's happening to you?!

battle-talk.speaker: Julia
battle-talk.line: Ahh... I... W-what in the world just...?

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Julia... You're…

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: You need to be careful, Fee. I know you can fly and all, but that doesn't mean you should just take off by yourself.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Oh? Are my ears playing tricks on me? Could it be you're actually worried about me, Arthur?

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Er... Yeah, I suppose so.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Hmmm! Who knew you had it in you? I never would've guessed that you're even able to worry about anyone but yourself! I might have to rethink everything just a bit!

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Well, er, you're something of a special case...

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Huh?

battle-talk.speaker: Arthur
battle-talk.line: Er, never mind! Anyway, just don't do anything too rash, alright? See you...

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Arthur…

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Lord Leif, the protection of the peninsula realm is our duty as House Leonster's remnants. We aren't in for an easy battle, but no matter what happens, we must persevere.

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: I know, Finn. I've always dreamed that this day, the day of Leonster's freedom, would come... I'll do all I can to bring peace to the peninsula and save the people from King Blume's tyranny. To fulfill Father's final wishes at last... And if I need to lay down my life to make our dream a reality, then so be it...

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Please, my lord! It ill befits a future king to do something so rash! You mustn't say such things!

battle-talk.speaker: Leif
battle-talk.line: Er, you're right... Sorry, Finn. I know how hard you had to work to protect me from the Empire's pursuit in my youth. I recall how often you'd let yourself starve, just so I wouldn't have to go without food... All my life you've made sacrifice after sacrifice for my sake, and only now do I understand this... I'll always be grateful for all you've done, Finn.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: My lord, the Thracian region has been plagued by strife for generations, but your father dared to dream of uniting it under a lasting peace. He may be gone, but you still yet live, and so too does the hope of fulfilling his dream. Only you stand a chance of uniting Thracia.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Hang on... Faval?! What d'you think you're doing? Ugh... Don't tell me you actually let Blume buy out your bow arm!

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Patty? Wait... Why are you with the rebels?

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: To protect people, of course! We've come this far working together, and I know we're gonna stop Blume for good! I don't get it. Did you just go and forget everything? That if it wasn't for the Empire's cruelty, none of the kids would be orphans? But no, here you are, kissing up to the very same man who ruined all our friends' lives! What the heck were you thinking, Faval?

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: You're absolutely right... I'm so sorry, Patty. I guess I just wasn't thinking at all.

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Any scumbag can apologize till their blue in the face! If you're really sorry, then get over here! Come help us fight for peace!

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Alright, Patty. I'm with you. You've certainly come a long way lately...

battle-talk.speaker: Patty
battle-talk.line: Hee hee... I guess I have!

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: Prince Seliph? Please, sir, forgive my foolishness!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Faval, yes? Patty has already told me your story. Relax! I understand why you did what you did. You've nothing to worry about.

battle-talk.speaker: Faval
battle-talk.line: I don't think so, sir. Letting myself work for the very same Empire I've supposedly been opposing? That was shamefully half-witted of me... Sir, I swear I'll make up for my bad choices. I'll do everything I can to aid you!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Faval. I'm glad to have you.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Pardon me, Tine. I don't suppose you're acquainted with Princess Ishtar?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: I am... When I was growing up, Ishtar was like a sister to me. She was one of the few who treated me well...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Would you have any idea who the man who came to collect her was, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: That... was most likely Prince Julius.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: The crown prince himself?! Are you certain?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: I think so, yes. The two are a couple. That would be why he...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Have you met Prince Julius before, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Tine
battle-talk.line: Once or twice, when I visited Belhalla. He... How can I put this... He has this odd charm which draws people to him... only for them to find that he's colder than ice. He's terrifying! If I didn't know better, I would swear he isn't even human…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Hey! You’re Ares, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: I am. What do you want?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: I’ve been hearing how you’re the son of Eldigan. Is there any truth to that?

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: There is. Of what concern is it yours?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Oh, I knew it was true! I’m Nanna. I’m the daughter of Lachesis, Lord Eldigan’s sister!

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: C-can this be?! Are you truly my aunt’s child?

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: Of course I am! You know, my mother was really worried about what happened to you. It must’ve been her search for you that brought us to Leonster all those years ago.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: My father knew well that the stormclouds of a brutal civil war lurked over Agustria. I was a mere infant and my mother was in poor health, so he bade her to seek refuge with her parents in Leonster. Alas, Leonster too fell afoul of a war of its own, and my mother lost her life to the Empire’s invasion.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: That’s where Jabarro comes in, right?

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: Indeed. Jabarro found me and took me in as his own, and with his mercenary corps, I travelled the world and learned the art of war.

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: So that’s why I’ve never found you before… Listen, Ares. My mother left me something to give to you if we ever met.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: Oh? ...What is this? Is this... Is this Father’s?!

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: It is! It’s a letter from Lord Eldigan, and it’s addressed to you, Ares.

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: I can’t believe it…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: This should sort everything out! It says your father and Sigurd were the closest of friends and held each other’s deepest trust. This never changed, no matter what…

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: So it says… Wow, I… I’ve been so, so wrong for all this time…

battle-talk.speaker: Nanna
battle-talk.line: I hope you’ll look after Lord Seliph, Ares. He really is depending on you!

battle-talk.speaker: Ares
battle-talk.line: I will, I promise you… Say, Nanna. How would you like a quick lesson in swordplay? Here, pay close attention…

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: Milord…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Ah, Mana. Is something the matter?

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: Er, see… I’m scared, milord. I mean, when we first left Isaach I was excited as anybody, but now… I watch everyone risking their lives over and over, and I...I know that sooner or later, it’ll be one of us who dies next.

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Mana…

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: You saw what the thunder mage did when we defeated her, didn’t you, milord? She just vanished in the blink of an eye! There’s something else at work here… An evil power beyond anything we know!

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: ...You aren’t alone, Mana. I’ve tried to hide it, but to be frank, I’m terrified as well. Often I find myself too fearful to sleep… Sometimes, the fear is so overwhelming that I wish I could run away… Just leave Jugdral and its troubles behind me. But I cannot… I will not. You saw the faces of the people when we freed Alster and Connaught, did you not? The very instant that we’d won, they were so overjoyed that they burst into tears! That’s how much freedom from the Empire means to them. We are the ones with the power to save Jugdral, Mana, and we must not shirk from that duty.

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: ...I’m so sorry, milord. I shouldn’t have made you worry like that. I’ll always give your cause all I have. I promise. But please, milord… Please be careful! I don’t know what we’d do without you…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Thank you, Mana. And I… I don’t know what I’d do without you.

battle-talk.speaker: Mana
battle-talk.line: Oh… Milord…

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Ced the Brave, I presume? I couldn't possibly thank you enough for all you've done for the people of Manster.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Lord Seliph... I'm so glad you're here at last. Sire, I implore you! Save this world! Too many of us have already given into despair... The city of Manster has been robbed by the Empire of countless young children. All were sent to the shrines in Miletos... I... I couldn't save even a single child. Me, brave? Hah! I hardly deserve such a lofty label. I'm just another coward...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: That isn't true, Ced! If I were to fight alone, I know that there'd be precious little that I could do. It was uniting the strength of my friends, a team effort, which brought us this far! And I believe that your strength could be a valuable part of our cause. Please, Ced the Brave. Grant us your power!

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Thank you, sire... You'll have my loyalty, no matter what!

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Huh?! Er, pardon me, Lord Seliph, but... ...That man standing by your side...

battle-talk.speaker: Seliph
battle-talk.line: Ah, Ced. I'd like you to meet Lewyn, my tactician.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Lewyn? I knew it. That's my father...

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Oh, Ced. I guess you've found me. Been a while, huh? How's things?

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: How's things? HOW'S THINGS?! Father, don't you realize? I've been searching for you for all this time! Do you even realize how long it's been since you ran away from home?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Oh, yeah. I guess it has been a few years... Hey, how's Erinys doing these days?

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: How dare you... Mother is DEAD! All we ever wanted was for her to see you one last time before she died... That's why I've been looking for you!

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Huh... Erinys... Such a shame, too...

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Are you capable of any emotion at all, Father?! You just heard your wife's dead, and you won't so much as shed a tear... And what about Fee? You've hurt her so much! It still pains her... She's adamant that she won't speak to you. You've known she was here all along, Father. Why didn't you try to fix this?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Look, Ced. I left my old life behind long ago for a reason. That goes for my wife and kids, too. End of story. That's all there is to it.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: ...Father?!

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Ced...? Cedsy! It IS you!

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Fee?! What are you doing here? Is something the matter?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: I've been looking for you, of course! I mean, you've been gone from Silesse for so long, and we had no idea where you were!

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: I know, Fee, and I'm sorry... See, what happened was I was passing through Manster in my search for Father. I would've moved on, but the people's plight was nothing short of heartbreaking. I couldn't just leave Manster to waste away...

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: I should've known. That is so like you, Cedsy! And here I was, almost starting to forget why you're so incredible.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: You're with the liberation army, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: Yep! I just knew I had to help Lord Seliph.

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Is that so... You're even more like Mother than I thought! Not once in her life did she ever turn her back on someone in need.

battle-talk.speaker: Fee
battle-talk.line: You're just like her, too, Cedsy... Poor Mom, though. Just thinking about how Dad left her... It makes me so mad!

battle-talk.speaker: Ced
battle-talk.line: Mm... I still can't make sense of his actions. What could he have possibly been thinking…

battle-talk.speaker: Femina
battle-talk.line: Hawke...? Hawkesy! It IS you!

battle-talk.speaker: Hawke
battle-talk.line: Femina?! What are you doing here? Is something the matter?

battle-talk.speaker: Femina
battle-talk.line: I've been looking for you, of course! I mean, you've been gone from Silesse for so long, and we had no idea where you were!

battle-talk.speaker: Hawke
battle-talk.line: I know, Femina, and I'm sorry... See, what happened was I was passing through Manster in my search for Father. I would've moved on, but the people's plight was nothing short of heartbreaking. I couldn't just leave Manster to waste away…

battle-talk.speaker: Femina
battle-talk.line: I should've known. That is so like you, Hawkesy! And here I was, almost starting to forget why you're so incredible.

battle-talk.speaker: Hawke
battle-talk.line: You're with the liberation army, then?

battle-talk.speaker: Femina
battle-talk.line: Yep! I just knew I had to help Lord Seliph.

battle-talk.speaker: Hawke
battle-talk.line: Is that so… I should have known. After all these years you’ve spent admiring Sigurd, it was inevitable you’d want to aid his son.

battle-talk.speaker: Femina
battle-talk.line: Yep! I’ve always dreamed of being a pegasus knight as great as the legendary Lady Erin. Just watch me, Hawkesy. I’ll get there someday!

boss.speaker: Coulter
boss.line: Heh heh... What a pity it is for you, that this is where you die!

boss.speaker: Coulter
boss.line: Gaaah! May Thracia... rise in glory…

boss.speaker: Maykov
boss.line: This land is the rightful land of the Kingdom of Thracia! You will never take it from us!

recruit-battle.speaker: Faval
recruit-battle.line: I'm so sorry... But we sorely need the gold…

recruit-battle.speaker: Faval
recruit-battle.line: Oh, Patty… Forgive your… fool of a brother…

recruit-battle.speaker: Faval
recruit-battle.line: Wait... Patty?! No, this... It's not what it looks like!
